summary: The End-of-life Access to Supportive and Essential Care Act of 2025 (EASE Act of 2025) amends Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to require hospitals to provide specific information on available hospice programs to Medicare patients upon discharge. The bill mandates that hospitals inform eligible individuals about hospice care options in their area, participating in the Medicare program. This is alongside existing requirements about home health and post-hospital extended care services. The amendments are to apply to discharges occurring on or after January 1, 2026.
